description: SODA Studio will lead two tours of Soho by day and by night to explore both historic and contemporary buildings that they know and love, which help create the modern 'village' we know today.

events.name: SODA x SOHO x DAY
events.notes: A walking tour led by SODA Studio

factsheet.heading: The Tour
paragraphs: The SODA Soho tour will take in a variety of projects that have contributed to the contemporary development of the area, such as:
The Boulevard Theatre, Soho's newest purpose-built theatre, with a revolving auditorium at its heart and a public-facing facade that reveals the activity within.
The Walker's Court neon, a striking piece of public art, which is a remade version of the original and iconic Raymond Revuebar sign.
Kettner's Townhouse, containing the original Soho House as well as the reborn restaurant of local fame – all housed within a block of 15 interconnected Georgian townhouses.
76 Dean Street, featuring a new addition to the Soho House family that now occupies a Georgian townhouse that was ravaged by fire but now includes meticulously reinstated details from 1732.
The tour will include references to other local landmarks and access may be limited to all buildings depending on their operating situation at the time of the walk.

images.title: The Revuebar neon sign within the theatreland setting

travel_info: Nearest tube: Oxford Circus, Leicester Square, Piccadilly Circus

name: Soho tour by SODA Studio
